Text:
....Phew, finally caught up with her. I gave myself
a hard time by dropping the bridge so forcefully.

More than that, I didn't think about coming back...!
Creating an attraction is a pretty hard task!
Oooh, what's this?

Right, take heart... This is the last and biggest
trial!

It should be the hardest one for Delta. This is the
Trial of Riddles!

There's something written on this signboard. Lemme
see... Huh?

“Only one path among these is the right one. Foolish.
Challenger. You. Cannot. See. The. Correct. One.“
Okay...

On the right, there are some bones on the ground.
Something strong is waiting there, maybe!

The middle tunnel has so many tasty looking
mushrooms! It's making me hungry!

I can hear the sound of burning flames from the left
one. It seems dangerous, so there must be treasure
hidden there!
All three tunnels look interesting!

Hmm, does she get it? You cannot see the correct
one... In other words, I have devised it so that the
treasure chest will fall down if she turns back.
So kind of Mr. Cave to have a signboard!
*facepalm*

S-Seriously... Why have I become the straight man in
this comedy?!

But Mr. Cave, I have no idea what you are writing
about! Not nice!

It would be nice if you made a sign that was more
considerate towards who sees it... Gah!

No...it's a trial you are supposed to solve. There is
no point to it if it's easy to understand.

I mean, don't you think it's weird that this cave has
signs or signboards?

You aren't thinking...but thanks to that I'm able to
monitor you.
This mean signboard is going to get it!

Don't break the signboard! ...Too late, she couldn't
help it.
Only one path is the right one, but I don't see nothing.

I mean you can't see if your eyes are closed, right?
Ooooh, what if I close my eyes?

Ha! And I was so worried! The reaction I was waiting
for is coming!

No answer in the answer is a trick question. If you
think about the riddle, the more you are made to think,
and you really get stuck on it!

There won't be any treasure if you don't solve it...
Even Delta shouldn't be able to brute-force her way
through this one.
Hmmm. HMMMMM.

Pushing through with your might won't work here.
Maybe she'll give up?

If you give up or admit defeat, then I will appear to
solve the riddle!

Isn't that such a shadowbroker move? The wise and
mysterious one who guides the lost protagonist...

Then he points to the way out and leaves. Is the wise
one an enemy? An ally?... Yes, that's how it should be.
Hmmm... Hmmm...

She stopped moving completely. Looks like she's
really thinking.

Right, need to show up at the right time. That will
be...when she next speaks!
*sniff, sniff*
Huh? Why have you started sniffing?
If you can't see your prey, sniff it out!

Down the right, there is only the smell of blood...
Down the middle there is the smell of poison.
Oh no, don't tell me you have sniffed out my trap?!

Down the left, there's just the smell of burning...
but the smell is all wrong!
Tch...!

From the entrance...I can smell my favorite Boss man!
Hah!
Wha—!
Awooo...hah! Boss man! It's Boss man!

Ah, crap... I forget about the therianthropes' sense
of smell and got too close!

She didn't sniff me out back at the hideout, so I
thought I was probably fine and didn't think too much
on it...
Boss man, whatcha doing here?
W-Well, because...
Oh! I got it! The true treasure of this cave!

It's Boss man! Of course! For me, Boss man is the
greatest treasure!

(I-I hate such stereotypical punchlines! The real
treasure was supposed to be plot development!)

(But you hit on your right answer and feel like it all
came together in the end!)

(Not solving the riddle properly would just give me
indigestion, and this type of result-oriented
thinking is so old school!)

I thought so hard and solved the riddle! Ehehe,
you gotta compliment me, Boss man!
...Y-Yeah, that's right.

(Ahhhh... It's hard to say you got it wrong when you
are beaming with that worry-free smile...)

Well done, Delta. You cleared the Cave of Trials
admirably!
Yay!! Yay! It was super tough!

First, a big rock came rolling down at me! Then there
were poisonous snakes!
Oh, wooow. Really? I had no idea...
(Well, at least she is happy...)
Heheheh, my treasure is always Boss man!
